IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO OFFER LOWER, MIDDLE AND UPPER SCHOOL EDUCATION WHICH ENGAGES THE IMAGINATION AND INTELLECT OF ITS STUDENTS, GUIDES THEM TOWARDS SELF-GOVERNANCE AND SELF-KNOWLEDGE AND ENCOURAGES THEIR RESPONSIBLE AND CARING PARTICIPATION IN THE WORLD.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO OFFER LOWER, MIDDLE AND UPPER SCHOOL EDUCATION WHICH ENGAGES THE IMAGINATION AND INTELLECT OF ITS STUDENTS, GUIDES THEM TOWARDS SELF-GOVERNANCE AND SELF-KNOWLEDGE AND ENCOURAGES THEIR RESPONSIBLE AND CARING PARTICIPATION IN THE WORLD.
IRS990.Description: PRIVATE EARLY CHILDHOOD, ELEMENTARY, MIDDLE AND SECONDARY EDUCATION UTILIZED BY APPROXIMATELY 550 STUDENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Waynflete has a policy of appropriating funds for distribution each year equal to 5% of its endowment fund's average fair value over the prior 12 quarters through the fiscal year-end preceding the fiscal year in which the distribution is planned. In accordance with UPMIFA, the School considers the following factors in making a determination to appropriate or accumulate donor-restricted endowment funds: the duration and preservation of the fund; the purposes of the School and donor-restricted endowment fund; general economic conditions; the possible effect of inflation and deflation; the expected total return from income and the appreciation of investments; other resources of the School; and the investment policies of the School.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE SCHOOL DOES NOT BELIEVE IT HAS TAKEN A POSITION ON ITS TAX RETURNS WHICH WOULD REQUIRE THE RECOGNITION OF A TAX BENEFIT AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HAS BEEN MADE.
LOSS FROM PLEDGE: -1949. UNREALIZED LOSS ON INTEREST RATE SWAP: -606835.
UNREALIZED LOSS ON INTEREST RATE SWAP: -606835. LOSS ON PLEDGE: -1949. SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES: 18460. CAPITAL CAMPAIGN EXPENSES: -2776.
SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES: 18460. CAPITAL CAMPAIGN EXPENSES: -2776.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: WAYNFLETE SCHOOL ADVERTISES THROUGH THE MAINE ASSOCIATION OF INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS COMBINED ADVERTISMENT FOR MEMBER SCHOOLS AND IN LOCAL NEWSPAPERS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS MONITORED EVERY YEAR, AS THE TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO COMPLETE A FORM ANNUALLY. IF A CONFLICT EXISTS, IT IS DISCUSSED AND RESOLVED AT THE BOARD LEVEL. TRUSTEES EXCUSE THEMSELVES FROM A VOTE WHEN A CONFLICT ARISES. ENFORCEMENT IS PART OF THE GOVERNING PROCESS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE MEMBERS OF THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES MET NUMEROUS TIMES OVER A PERIOD OF MONTHS TO RESEARCH, ANALYZE, NEGOTIATE AND SIGN THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S CURRENT CONTRACT. COMMITTEE MINUTES WERE TAKEN AND REMAIN ON FILE WITH OTHER BOARD DOCUMENTS. MEETINGS TOOK PLACE DURING THE SPRING OF 2008 AND RESUMED AFTER THE SUMMER INTO THE 2008-2009 SCHOOL YEAR. TO PROVIDE EXPERTISE AND ENHANCE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF THE COMPETITIVE LANDSCAPE, COMPARATIVE FINANCIAL DATA, RELEVANT CHANGES IN DEFERRED COMPENSATION REGULATIONS AND GOAL SETTING BENCHMARKS, A COMPENSATION CONSULTANT WAS RETAINED. A NUMBER OF POTENTIAL CONSULTANTS WERE CONSIDERED AND EXTENSIVE INTERVIEWS CONDUCTED WITH THREE OF THEM. THE COMMITTEE ELECTED TO WORK WITH PETER CALFEE OF CALFEE FINANCIAL. THE COMMITTEE WORKED WITH MR. CALFEE OVER MANY MONTHS TO CONSTRUCT FAIR AND COMPETITIVE CONTRACT TERMS. MR. CALFEE PROVIDED A REBUTTABLE PRESUMPTION LETTER TO THE COMMITTEE AT THE CONCLUSION OF OUR WORK. THE COMMITTEE ALSO WORKED WITH TWO ATTORNEYS TO REVIEW THE CONTRACT LANGUAGE AND TO WRITE THE SCHOOL'S 457(F) PLAN. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWED THE PRIOR CONTRACT AND EXAMINED SALARY, BENEFITS AND DEFERRED COMPENSATION DATA FOR PEER SCHOOLS AS WELL AS SCHOOLS NATIONALLY. DATA EXAMINED WAS SOURCED FROM NAIS, THE 990'S OF OTHER SCHOOLS AND THE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT RETAINED BY THE COMMITTEE. DATA WAS EXAMINED FOR HEADS WITH MODEST EXPERIENCE TO THOSE WITH EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE, AND FOR SCHOOLS ACROSS A VARIETY OF SIZES. OUR GOAL WAS TO PROVIDE A PACKAGE THAT WAS COMPETITIVE, MARKET DRIVEN, FAIR AND REPRESENTATIVE OF THE VALUE MARK SEGAR BRINGS TO THE SCHOOL. THE COMMITTEE'S WORK WAS PRESENTED ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS TO THE FULL BOARD AND INCLUDED THE OPPORTUNITY FOR BOARD MEMBERS TO SPEAK DIRECTLY WITH THE OUTSIDE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT. THE FINAL COMPONENTS OF THE CONTRACT WERE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PROCESS FOR INDEPENDENT AUDITOR SELECTION AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT DID NOT CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
